C++ - Static keyword

  • Introduction
  • Static Examples
  • References

  1. Introduction

    Static usage is different in different scenario.

  2. Static Examples

    1. Static variables in a class

      Just initialized once, shared by all objects. Just have one copy in an entire process

      non const static cannot initialize when declaration

      static variable is stored outside of any object.

      #include <iostream>
using namespace std;

class F{
public:
    static int counter; // initialize non-const static variable in definition is not allowed.
    const static double pi = 3.1415; // OK
    F(){
        counter++;
    }
};
int F::counter = 0; // this line must be included. It initialize/define this value, otherwise linker cannot found this variable.
int main(){
    F f[10];
    cout << f[0].counter < F::counter < endl; // 1010 
}

    2. Static function in a class

      Can only access static members. Can be called by Class::func(), or object.func(). The first one is recommanded.
